articles.description: For two years, Facebook has been hijacked, vilified, and besieged. Here's the inside story of the struggle.
articles.title: Inside Facebook's Hellish Two Years—and Mark Zuckerberg's Struggle to Fix it All
articles.author: Nicholas Thompson

articles.description: The president’s budget request is out, and this is what it means for NASA and its plans to put astronauts on the Moon.
articles.title: Trump’s budget for NASA defunds the space station and includes vague plans for the Moon
articles.author: Loren Grush

articles.description: Unilever, one of the largest consumer goods companies in the world, is threatening to pull advertising from Google, YouTube, and Facebook if the tech giants don’t rid their platforms of extremism, hate speech, and fake news. Unilever is particularly disturbed…
articles.title: Unilever, Owner of Dove and Ben & Jerry's, Threatens to Stop Advertising on 'The Swamp' of Google and Facebook
articles.author: Matt Novak

articles.description: On Monday, Wired published an inside look at Facebook’s struggles with fake news over the last two years. It should come as no surprise that Mark Zuckerberg still doesn’t think of Facebook as a media company, but an eye-opening story from 2007 reveals that in…
articles.title: Rupert Murdoch's MySpace Apparently Still Haunts Mark Zuckerberg
articles.author: Rhett Jones

articles.description: President Trump on Monday at the White House. He signed a two-year spending plan last week that largely supersedes the budget his administration proposed Monday.
articles.title: Right and Left React to the Soaring Budget Deficit
articles.author: ANNA DUBENKO

articles.description: Attorney General Jeff Sessions, left; Rod Rosenstein, deputy attorney general; and Rachel Brand, associate attorney general, at the Justice Department this month.
articles.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Is Trump Working On a Different Kind of ‘Massacre’?
articles.author: ARI MELBER

articles.description: The White House releases a proposed budget that is largely irrelevant, given Congress passed a spending bill last week that outlines priorities.
articles.title: As White House Releases Budget, Congress Sets Spending Priorities
articles.author: JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

articles.description: On Monday afternoon, the Senate will begin a novel legislative adventure. Lawmakers will try to assemble immigration legislation that can garner 60 votes.
articles.title: Senate to Hold Immigration Debate — With the Outcome Unknown
articles.author: SHERYL GAY STOLBERG

articles.description: Retirements and reversals in gerrymandering give Democrats a clearer path to a majority.
articles.title: Big Republican Advantages Are Eroding in the Race for House Control
articles.author: NATE COHN

articles.description: Zakia Abu Ajwa collecting spoiled produce from a market at a refugee camp in the Gaza Strip. U.N. officials warn that the territory is nearing total collapse, with medical supplies dwindling, clinics closing and 12-hour power failures threatening hospitals.
articles.title: White House, Winter Olympics, New York Fashion Week: Your Monday Briefing
articles.author: CHRIS STANFORD

articles.description: Terrill Thomas was left in a cell without water for seven days in 2016, and a supervisor then repeatedly lied about the events that led to Mr. Thomas’s death, prosecutors said.
articles.title: Three Milwaukee Jail Officers Charged in Dehydration Death
articles.author: MITCH SMITH

articles.description: In this play directed by Thomas Ostermeier and starring Nina Hoss, a French philosopher ponders the move to the right in blue-collar France.
articles.title: Review: ‘Returning to Reims’ and Those European Working-Class Blues
articles.author: BEN BRANTLEY

articles.description: Getting lured into a kidnapper’s trap. Bidding goodbye to friends forever. Before they were unauthorized immigrants, they were children on cross-border journeys.
articles.title: The Childhood Journeys That Made Them ‘Dreamers’
articles.author: CAITLIN DICKERSON

articles.description: The Trump administration's big infrastructure plan, unveiled Monday, amounts to the largest rewrite of one of the nation's bedrock environmental laws in decades. It would dramatically speed up the permitting of all sorts of structures — not just roads and bri…
articles.title: Coming soon to US national parks: Oil and gas pipelines, thanks to Trump's new plan
articles.author: Andrew Freedman

articles.description: The Trump administration is serious about sending robots and spacecraft back to the moon — although no NASA astronaut will set foot on the chalky lunar surface until after President Trump leaves office. The White House released its Fiscal Year 2019 NASA budge…
articles.title: Trump wants NASA astronauts back on the moon, but it won't happen while he's in office
articles.author: Mark Kaufman

articles.description: It's no secret the Dutch are quite good at speed skating. Athletes from the Netherlands have already claimed two gold medals at the Winter Olympics. In fact, all three medals in the ladies' 3,000 metre event went to Dutch competitors, and you can bet there's …
articles.title: You have to hear this bluff about why the Dutch are good at speed skating
articles.author: Johnny Lieu

articles.description: Looking for something to cry at today? You're in luck! The Obamas just unveiled their official portraits. On Monday the former POTUS and FLOTUS pulled the curtains off of stunning new portraits of themselves that will hang in Washington, D.C. Smithsonian's Na…
articles.title: Watch the Obamas unveil their Smithsonian portraits and cry
articles.author: Nicole Gallucci

articles.description: A petroleum platform off the California coast. The Trump administration announced a big expansion in offshore oil drilling last month, but exempted Florida.
articles.title: Op-Ed Columnist: Trumpism for Thee, but Not for Me

articles.title: ‘An Extraordinary Moment’: Explaining the Russia Inquiry
